Subject: Dance
Text: By the end of Year 8, students analyse how the elements of dance, choreographic devices and/or production elements are manipulated in dance they create and/or experience.

Subject: Dance
Text: They evaluate the ways that dance works and/or performances in a range of styles and/or from across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning.

Subject: Dance
Text: They describe respectful approaches to creating, performing and/or responding to dance.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students manipulate the elements of dance and choreographic devices to choreograph dance that communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning.

Subject: Dance
Text: They demonstrate safe dance practice when choreographing and performing dance.

Subject: Dance
Text: They employ technical and expressive skills and, as appropriate, genre- or style-specific techniques when performing dances for audiences.

Subject: Dance
Text: By the end of Year 10, students analyse how and/or why the elements of dance, choreographic devices, genre- or style-specific techniques, production elements, and/or technical and expressive skills are manipulated in dance they create and/or experience.

Subject: Dance
Text: They evaluate how dance works and/or performances in a range of styles and/or from across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning.

Subject: Dance
Text: They evaluate how dance is used to celebrate and challenge perspectives of Australian identity.

Subject: Dance
Text: Students select and manipulate the elements of dance, choreographic devices and/or structure to choreograph dances.

Subject: Dance
Text: They demonstrate safe dance practice when choreographing and performing dance.

Subject: Dance
Text: They employ technical and expressive skills and genre- or style-specific techniques to enhance communication of ideas, perspectives and/or meaning when performing dance for audiences.
